9304D39179A84C0C8A124C4A90022E9B.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer. Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

319217FF9B694D3E86E06073F155B015.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

BD67DEF77F104EF48D0B43804707E161.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals

22E5D8BBF43E411C8B1612BB941B3589.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

3A415254000448D0B0520BB73E9CD2E6.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

F7C60EB8F8AC47FFB8837E942C91F602.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

F8C09495E5BE490A8D6FD93C9CDDD8FC.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

2F4B4914E37F4BC79EC4F222B0CFB8C3.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

2968BC1B8FE34775A2384835C0CDFE14.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

8AF321A7CB9B417C99FC06D02D079272.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

DF53305043A340E39342B8CC7857000B.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

D6C341406CBE4FA993ACC44139026825.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

4EEB74AE6D144BB090A14FDFBB9DF72E.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear?, Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

A0F6D05E3535411688AF9A8032925F8D.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

9809131322684930A56EB737085DC6B3.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

D3509DCA507C4510886716633262BF63.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

A30226320F434AF3AA2817A2BD4C42E5.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

4F3C3A27CF1847949328EBABAD226E66.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

2BD6244CD8744957872B01A7199E9AF0.description: Participate in a workplace-based career development opportunity (e.g., job shadow and career spotlight) related to robotics and automation.

2F260F0E1C3949C895EB17F8D6F8A4A7.description: Participate in a career fair and analyze robotics related career choices based on information gathered.

BC3C69898F6E4950B2AD2C14657905BB.description: Develop a profile of a specific individual involved in a robotics-related career, addressing factors such as their educational and personal background, what drew them to their career, the focus of their work and their advice for others who wish to pursue a similar career.

0EDAEF977CCA444EBA695939D3875FCC.description: Visit post-secondary institutions (e.g., University of Saskatchewan, University of Regina and Saskatchewan Polytechnic) that offer courses related to robotics and automation.

7B90F3940EA344FDB0252752A61BD9A9.description: Visit local businesses and organizations that use or make robotics, such as health care robots, agriculture robots or robot chefs.

BA6C2B13AE14468993ABD15A9E25E254.description: Research robotics related career paths in Saskatchewan, Canada, and the world.

9583DF7157D34BDC84979E7FF9AC6BCD.description: Careers in Robotics and Automation C (Core)

B628EEA247BB4FC68BC43C011ADE0FC5.description: Demonstrate increasingly proficient fabrication techniques, work skills, and presentation skills.

86DDAB407DA14C1E97DB087E46D13425.description: Assemble and present a project utilizing skills in planning and management as outlined in Module 67A: Introductory Project.

11C5C1A972A1462DBBD776A9459DCEED.description: Construct an advanced level assigned or approved robotics or automation project.

32407C051F834E0FB732F492601872F9.description: Self-assess one’s contribution to group projects

762300F89C3B4AB494CCD972909D667D.description: Monitor and adjust project timeline and task assignments in response to changing circumstances

878A109D6077450FB3F7901E07D0E1F8.description: Apply a detailed project design including: identifying the tasks necessary in completing a large project; assigning tasks to team members that takes advantage of their skills and interests; and, generating a timeline for task completion.

4F09794D0EC044D2A625DD9042EE09B2.description: Discuss group processes that affect team effectiveness.

56E8D72D401D4854A31C5312D683DB40.description: Design, implement and manage a detailed project plan that utilizes team member strengths and interests.

BD8447E579664086807FDC0896087CC4.description: Differentiate between machine vision, computer vision, machine learning and artificial intelligence.

8183A42D6DB946A3B6DFB64250E1352F.description: Explain the processes and technologies associated with machine vision.

BA032DCD88AA43B29DE148EC9B5C72D8.description: Investigate the use of machine vision in robotics and automation applications.

5F086A45C5574AE2AEF7985918A7715D.description: Construct a hydraulic and/or pneumatic component (e.g., pneumatic arm, hydraulic lifter, pneumatic clamp and propulsion system) for a mechanical purpose.

A0F304756D4C4FDEB48AF8E14C78CCC8.description: Identify common types (e.g., flanged, tie rod, threaded end, one-piece welded, single-acting, double-acting and telescoping) of pneumatic cylinders and how they might be used in robotics and automation applications.

111900B9F60A456A97B233C71BF46FD3.description: Explain the importance of the safety relief valve on a pneumatic component.

356B3755FF684E6AB9BC2D41F0AD878D.description: Describe how a positive displacement compressor works.

5423FC5B1A0B47C4B01E60AE2909591C.description: Identify the advantages and disadvantages (e.g., strength, speed, fluid supply and leaks) of a fluid power system.

559C0A02073D476DB4EA9828ECEE382A.description: Design, construct, and evaluate a prototype of a device that models the operation of a fluid power system.

893F3C9BA9794D2CACBE87978351936C.description: Describe how hydraulic or pneumatic pressure can be used to create a mechanical advantage in a simple mechanical device such as a hydraulic lift or pneumatic arm.

FE116E806D7C4B4996DE5B3B326D0145.description: Construct a mechanical device that incorporates principles of fluid power systems.

569B0AB0A96C471EACD72878A8706D2B.description: Construct threedimensional (3D) objects using computer numerical control (CNC) manufacturing.

06F6A604EF3343C1928255699DFC5D58.description: Manufacture 2D objects using a CNC machine.

47686232B2784169984C56E344A0CB64.description: Construct twodimensional (2D) objects using computer numerical control (CNC) manufacturing.

AADB2888566145E0A25476045533CD41.description: Create an object using a 3D printer and test it as a solution to a problem.

0633CF420D4A45E9B28B0E1F29AF363A.description: Utilize 3D design or modeling software to create a digital representation of a prototyped solution.

82911A44FD9F4BBD83A8F765713340AF.description: Develop a prototype of a solution to a problem using a variety of materials (e.g., plasticine, cardboard, tape and wire).

8FAE9877C2424460B9EA0A8B6562E4A9.description: Design a 3D printed object to solve a problem encountered in robotics and automation applications.

BD601566E69D482C808C89C9B6BC5DAA.description: Incorporate a single part in a device.

8861A8C8C5DC4022ABF8E171EF1DFEA4.description: Design and create a single part for use in a device.

A4EBC94239B549EF8EB974F5A21239B8.description: Demonstrate advanced electrical wiring and building skills through improved wire management, proper component usage and improved building and material efficiency, when constructing a drone.

0F0485FDFBA04C6EA110A9E35AEB4E06.description: Develop and carry out a project plan to construct a drone, including major stages of development and a timeline needed for completion.

01747C4090484EB8A30360A582358839.description: Calculate the cost of materials to construct a drone.

BE57AF8F09BE4B2C8184B571CB2F728A.description: Create a scale drawing of a drone project using appropriate symbols.

7DE54DE07ACF4065913B9DB1CB99F2AB.description: Use a simulator program to practice drone control and flight

2654BC7812954BA4A87CBB862732B3AC.description: Provide examples of civil, commercial and military applications of drones.

6A0373468A59412CBA36F8DD692DCCCB.description: Review ethics and local laws pertaining to drone usage.

1579B48DE6F3403AB6477235385BE70F.description: Explain the advantages and disadvantages of drone technology.

A413E067A245447A810469AAC30F4BAA.description: Experiment with the movement and workings of a drone.

72A41B045F674A179B17F43535588405.description: Design and construct a device using multiple infrared sensors to perform a task involving manipulating outputs (e.g., change movement based on inputs, alter direction of movement or reach out to touch an object)

F1E40F39EA9F4247B1882D3AA78AFC9F.description: Program a device to make decisions (e.g., navigate a maze and stop when in a dead end or follow a wall around a room) using inputs from multiple infrared sensors.

4F27BB7CA0B84059AA03B21A326446CF.description: Construct and program a device that uses multiple infrared sensors to make decisions.

4403D9ADB6FB49BABDE4BC159E680E4F.description: Evaluate the usefulness of an ultrasonic sensor in various situations.

8E96785EA85144F0A694920D2D0F45D0.description: Design and construct a device using multiple ultrasonic sensors to perform a task involving manipulating outputs (e.g., change movement based on inputs or alter direction of movement or reach out to touch an object).

7EAE05D170F7452E8C8EF232BA05F9B5.description: Provide examples of how ultrasonic sensors are used in manufacturing environments to automate process control and maximize efficiency.

AF5A518260074AE6BA284BED3FC2A36F.description: Program a device to make decisions (e.g., navigate a maze and stop when in a dead end or follow a wall around a room) using inputs from multiple ultrasonic sensors

6336A4541C314B06B89C8E16D6CB5C29.description: Construct and program a device that uses multiple ultrasonic sensors to make decisions

D4CD9D9A192D4B1E9AC0AD599B9E19CD.description: Program a device to follow a dotted line, including curves, 90-degree turns and T-junctions using input from a line follower sensor.

7BD61BF0B6F44DF4B0B65381B6F18994.description: Program a device to make a decision at the end of a line using input from a line follower sensor

81AC7F5CAFCE4E2BAA9BF2CB1014CA7A.description: Program a device to follow a complex solid line, including curves, 90-degree turns, greater than 90 degree turns and T-junctions using input from a line follower sensor.

6310ABA5BE6C4232A36FC81048BC6770.description: Construct and program a device capable of following a complex line, including dotted line sections.

A8C978FC8A9A4BDEA531BD6138ABD1AA.description: Create a recursive function to solve a programming problem.

417E34631FCE4F40A99C4356B632B3A1.description: Provide examples of situations where it is advantageous to use recursive functions in programming robotic and automated devices.

C9182A61FE004D1D863275C5C0D79764.description: Explain the importance of the terminating or base condition in a recursive function.

7C90F6E300344907B93C504D1F9FE7EB.description: Recognize that a recursive function is one that calls itself to solve a smaller instance of the same problem.

C4FB4AA35B214EF48D3810A2B12A5F06.description: Differentiate between the functionality of a loop (i.e., iteration) and a recursive function (i.e., recursion).

D08BF41CCB534A34AC1EE8A9B6EE3243.description: Investigate how and when to incorporate recursive functions into programs.

37696463D0134746A2F34B97A1A52DCC.description: Create a library to meet a specific need.

D73AD3DCF1D44C3B924BD4E98FAC6B86.description: Discuss why programming languages make use of libraries.

46127E954A45454CBDF196ECB8EE1CE2.description: Recognize that a library is a compilation of functions that can extend the functionality of software.

FF9BF1D684564EBC9984CB258CD9684A.description: Incorporate internal, external and userdefined libraries to extend the functionality of software.

BCEED24E4E6D449DAC3F990417338BF7.description: Using information from a datasheet, determine the proper parameters for a given electronic component to be used in a project.

0076C5E186424961A0F533A2BD52B618.description: Indicate where datasheets for electronic components can be found.

F1BDB4E57B9E48DAA28753038E627640.description: Discuss what datasheets (or spec sheets) are and their purposes in robotics construction.

1E73E9B7B2B04A018AA6032CAC3410BB.description: Examine the importance of datasheets for providing information about the technical characteristics of electronic components

BBD08B29DDDB46518954F4C9F520CFE4.description: Explore how fuses should be wired in an electrical circuit.

05B53A80BDD741619C5048CF47EAD4AA.description: Explain the use of different fuse types (e.g., plug fuses, cartridge fuses, time-delay fuses and renewable fuses)

2A04E3C8159E47BBB028DB318A39579D.description: Discuss what occurs in a circuit that is experiencing a short circuit situation.

E495ADBC8F054BBC902A2045EEDC922A.description: Discuss what it means for a circuit to be overloaded.

93A8FDDA4E1B401AA82DECD4065525BA.description: Explore how fuses are used to protect circuits.

B89E310F873F4713A947FBFBFE78B9F0.description: Design and construct a complex circuit that is composed of multiple simple circuits and that contains inputs and outputs.

4A1DB7C07D50460AB7646B02E646B0E4.description: Design and construct a motor control circuit (e.g., H-Bridge) using an integrated circuit (IC) or transistor.

2D2729ADC62049AB88AC788533212845.description: Design and construct a circuit that uses a transistor circuit (e.g., 5-5-5 timer) to control a higher current device.

9AF859FB636C4514AFB0FEB985454043.description: Design and construct a variety of circuits to interface between a programmable control board and a robotic or automated device.

D8A52FC4F62642F3AC0799D54A1734B3.description: Identify safe current and/or voltage values pertaining to personal safety.

7E3A29EBD4CA4FDFAFF78B20C143FE23.description: Identify safe current and/or voltage values pertaining to equipment safety.

F9626B73752447158A3EC3C74E684C42.description: Understand the need for circuit protection in an electrical circuit.

6D2227977CF047AA83EC31DFBEAF383B.description: Review safety procedures (e.g., inspect equipment for damaged or frayed wires, ensure proper grounding and ensure work area is free from liquids) for working with electrical equipment.

4CE46F83FFE448B498EABB08E0CDA9D5.description: Demonstrate safe practices when working with electricity and electrical devices.

0670939AFC1249FBB3CC92ECA8706BFF.description: Share project progress with the end user(s) at regular intervals to elicit feedback and ensure the project is meeting their needs.

A60DA0F815D14E39A0F691E09D4BDA58.description: Reflect on whether proposed solutions address actual versus perceived problems

D4E5C2CA6BC244338209CD42701CF426.description: Develop and implement a plan to resolve multiple issues present in a device.

2FD36040CC4F43E5AA00308614CBBBF1.description: Practice good housekeeping and avoid obvious hazards (e.g., touching live wires, extending cords over walking spaces and leaving objects on the floor).

524A425F6AA341DCBC2CDBCD5A073AF8.description: Explain the purpose of ventilation in a confined environment.

F1F9630119E04CE9AE830B92D875F2CB.description: Apply accident prevention principles and techniques, and discuss appropriate actions in case of an injury or accident, such as whom to contact, fire extinguisher locations, emergency exit routes and first-aid procedures.

3269C525F2F84CC481F73ED13C503356.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in the work area.
